Description: Fragment from a corner of a warp-faced plain weave, undyed, linen tunic (a) with tapestry (single warp threads) panel (b); Hitched warp fringe; On (a), c.2.2cm above the fringe, are bare warp threads and c.2.2cm above the bare threads are 8 ribs of 3 weft threads grouped (2 ribs/2 normal picks/2ribs); Warp (a): S spun linen, c.23tpc; Weft (a): S spun linen, c.13tpc; Edges: one plain selvedge and at the adjacent edge the fringe (c.2cm long), other edges cut; Sewing: (b) sewn to (a) with S spun Z ply linen thread, mosting hemming of turned under edges but also running stitch on two sides. The applied, sqaure panel (b) is c.8.8cm above the fringe; Centre is mainly purple-coloured wool but with traces of worn outline design in undyed linen in flying thread brocading; Design of curling double ribbons forming a grid of 4 to 5 squares; Outer border of plain undyed linen; Warp: undyed, S spun wool?, c.13tpb; Weft: S spun linen & wool, c.60tpc; Edges: not visible as turned under
Curator's comments: Similar to EA72487; Previous location M3/P; Edges cut post excavation; (b) appears to be worven to be applied and not re-used; Information from Hero Granger-Tatlor (5.7.1994)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
